You’ve just had the best fuck you could ever remember, you’re not going to let it go for some stupid work bollocks.

“I want your phone number before you leave.” He hums into your skin between kisses, pressing a chaste kiss to the bend of your jaw.

“Oh yeah?” You tease, tilting your head slightly to try and see his face.

“Abso-fucking-lutely.” He insists, pulling his head up to meet your gaze.

“Fine by me, handsome.”

~

“What’s he talking about?” Fee asks, oblivious to the comment Dillon had made moments prior.

“You told him?!” You screech at your husband, glaring at him with a newfound anger.

“He is eighteen, love.” Harry attempts to reason, shifting properly in his seat to meet your burning gaze. “I don’t see a reason to hide it any more.”

“I didn’t want our children knowing how quickly we fell into bed together!” You scold, quickly turning to bring the frying pan off the heat before the eggs turn hard.

“Ew.” Fee grumbles quietly.

Harry gesticulates his arms wide and rolls his eyes. “It’s not as bad as it sounds, trust me!”

“Er, you slept together within ‘alf an hour of knowin’ each other,” Tom interjects with a frown, “can’t get much easier than that.”

Harry grimaces. “Tom, shut up!”

“Are you calling me easy?” You ask bitterly, turning your glare to Tom.

“You married the bloke so why does it matter?!” He defends pointlessly.

“I can’t believe you told him.” You grumble, spinning back to your breakfast preparation. “There’s a reason why I didn’t want anyone to know, and Tom has just proved my sodding point.”

“Okay, so all the people in this room know, but it doesn’t matter now because they’re not going to tell anyone and we didn’t sleep with anyone else after anyway!” Harry reasons, standing from his seat to make his way over to you.

“It still doesn’t remove the fact that I gave myself up to you so easily!”

“You were tired, so was I! We fell in love didn’t we?!”

You roll your head back in frustration, gritting your teeth. “It’s still not a great example to set for our daughter, Harry.”

“Someone back me up, please?!” Harry turns back to the room, all of whom just shrug at him. “Oh sod off. Like I said, love, they’re not going to tell anyone, it’s never going to leave this room.”

“It fucking better not, otherwise there really will be hell to pay.” You warn, pointing between each of them with a spatula.

“Wait,” Fee mumbles, “I still don’t actually know how you met…”

The room ceremoniously groans, half expecting you to lose it again.

“And it’s going to stay that way until you’re thirty five.” You conclude, just as Harry pecks an apologetic kiss to your temple.

Tom laughs at Harry’s fawning. “Kiss her all you like, mate but you’re in the doghouse.”

~Series Masterlist~

Thanking you endlessly!

Your head peers up from the feast you’re preparing for your Sunday morning breakfast to Fee who asked the question. “Course we can!”

You miss the glance that Harry and Dillon share, but Tom notices and is immediately confused.

summary: Let’s all think of Harry cooking you your favourite meal followed by the most scrumptious desert, all because you’ve had a long...
question: Let’s all think of Harry cooking you your favourite meal followed by the most scrumptious desert, all because you’ve had a long week and he wants to take care of you - ☠️
answer:
Yes, let’s!

Especially after a glass of wine or two! He’d be all happy, cheery and dancing, doing as many stupid and daft things as possible to try and cheer you up.

He won’t accept your offer for help, with a simple, “No!” before he ushers you back to the dining table with frantic gestures of his arms.

He’d probably sing really loud to music, your favourite music as he prances around your kitchen in the most ludicrous ways.

He’d ask how you want everything seasoned, how much wine you want in your sauce (cooking tip from yours truly) and how big a portion you want. But when you say not much he ignores it because ‘not much’ is not an appropriate size for your biggest meal of the day.

He’d top up your glass with more wine every now and then like a true sommelier and entertainer, jokingly listing off all the qualities of the wine that he actually learned from you.

And then after it all he’d run you a bath and definitely join you in it, just to take extra care of the tight muscles in your back.

~~~

Gee thanks, I got carried away….

summary: like a boomerang, coming soon "You can’t be serious!” Harper was quick to stand on her feet. Honey purred at Harper’s feet,...
caption:
like a boomerang, coming soon

“You can’t be serious!” Harper was quick to stand on her feet. Honey purred at Harper’s feet, rubbing her back against Harper’s bare legs. She was hungry, but Harper couldn’t will herself to think about her.

“It was just a joke,” Harper nervously laughs, swallowing the boulder that had lodged itself in her throat. Her mouth was drier than the Sahara desert and she could  feel the tips of her ear warming up. She didn’t plan for this.

But Harry’s somber expression didn’t waver from his face. His eyes were set, and Harper couldn’t remember seeing someone as sure of themselves as Harry was. Hell, even Willow had flickers of doubt in her eyes when Dylan proposed to her.

“Maybe it was,” He emphasized, rooted to the ground as Honey padded between them, “But I think it’s a brilliant idea. You’ll have your sister leave you alone and as for myself-” the left side of his lips curled upward and a sinister smile- not smirk, smile- appeared on his face, “what more better way of getting rid of my ex than this?”

a story about moving on and letting go, and possibly about not mixing up the line between pretend and reality

e afeto em frente ao mar.
